titles: The anarchie or the blest reformation since 1640. Being a new song,  wherein the people expresse their thankes and pray for the reformers. To be said or sung of all the well affected of the kingdome of England, and dominion of Wales, before the breaking up of this unhappy Parliament. To a rare new tune.
author: Jordan, Thomas, 1612?-1685?
notes: Satiric verse - "Now that thankes to the powers below,".
The words "or .. 1640." and "Being .. reformers." are bracketed together in title.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Political ballads and songs --  Great Britain --  Early works to 1800.
